title: How to repair an SD card - Quora

response.answer_text: I have previously answered several similar questions. In case of a physical/logical damage, you may try following Brian Gill advice here. My approach would be different: in case you need to not only repair your SD card, but also get your data from it safely (because in most cases, this is what people are looking for, since SD cards are relatively cheap), you might want to create and an image file of your SD card and run it though with some data recovery service, e.g. Restore.Media or the like. Here’s an article of mine of how to get your data back from the damaged SD card: How To Recover Data From A Corrupt SD card – Alexandra Gurina – Medium

If you are trying to repair a damaged SD card then... 1. Run a Command prompt as Admin and type this "CHKDSK [driveletter] /r", Once the process completes it will give you some information on what has done exactly. 2. Some virus or some causing files might be affecting the SD card to crash. Formatting the SD card simply removes the viruses and the files thereafter letting the SD card to work again. But there is one thing, after formatting the SD card you would not be able to get your all of the data back! 3. Troubleshoot and diagnose the SD card using the tools on the computer. Connect the SD card using the card reader and then through using the tools find out any issues with the card. There are various tools available for repairing the SD card so you can use them for the advantage.  for more guidness, you can visit this link: http://www.theinsidertechnology.com/how-to-repair-damaged-corrupted-sd-card/
